page.title: 01Part of Piddle Valley
page.content: This area of Dorset consists of 3 isolated farms with cottages combined with 4 small villages - Affpuddle, Briantspuddle, Throop, and Turners Puddle, which are in the valley of the river Piddle which meanders throught the southern part of this block. The A35 trunk road bisects the centre of the block which takes traffic from Poole and Wimbourne to Dorchester via Bere Regis. Farming is the main industry in the area being a mixture of cultivated pastures and rough grazing for fresian (milk) cattle and sheep, which mainly graze on the fields to the north of the A35. A farm shop can be found on the road selling local produce. The 4 villages are unspoilt and consist of thatched cottages, stone churches and are linked by narrow country lanes bordered by hedgerows.
